English: Like I said!
Chinese: 所以說！
Korean: ―그러니까!
German: Wie ich schon gesagt habe!

English:
The day of reckoning has come for hackers who want
to use Digimon for evil purposes!
Chinese:
我沒辦法再放任那些
利用數碼寶貝為非作歹的駭客了！！
Korean:
나쁜 일에 디지몬을 이용하는 해커들을
이 이상 내버려 둘 수 없다고!!
German:
Für Hacker, die Digimon für böse Zwecke
missbrauchen, ist der Tag der Abrechnung gekommen!

English:
Oh, [p]!
You're late! Why are you always late like this?
Chinese:
啊！　[p]！
慢死了！　你每次都這麼慢！
Korean:
아! [p]!
늦어―! 넌 정말, 항―상 늦어!
German:
Ach, [p]!
Du bist spät dran!
Warum kommst du immer zu spät?

English:
Back to what we were talking about.
What do you mean by "day of reckoning" exactly?
Chinese:
然後呢？
妳沒辦法放任他們不管，那又怎樣？
Korean:
…그래서?
내버려 둘 수 없으니까 어쩌겠다는 거야
German:
Zurück zum Thema.
Was genau meinst du mit „Tag der Abrechnung“?

English:
Isn't it obvious?! We'll take out the hackers and
save the Digimon!
Chinese:
那還用說嗎？為了拯救那些數碼寶貝，
得去打倒那些駭客才行！
Korean:
뻔하잖아! 디지몬들을 구하기 위해서,
해커들을 해치우는 거야!!
German:
Ist das nicht sonnenklar?! Wir erledigen die
Hacker und retten die Digimon!

English: Hey, uh... Isn't that a bit high-handed?
Chinese: 喂喂喂……看妳這麼激動……
Korean: 야야… 꽤나 기세가 등등하구만…
German:
Ähm, das hört sich aber arg nach Holzhammermethode
an.

English:
Losing to Fei earlier made it very apparent that
I don't have the chops to do this on my own!
Chinese:
自從之前我敗給菲之後……
我就很清楚我的能力有多麼不足！
Korean:
얼마 전에, 페이에게 졌을 때부터…
내 힘이 부족하다는 건 잘 알고 있어!
German:
Als ich gegen Fei verloren habe, wurde klar, dass
ich alleine nicht das Zeug dazu habe!

English:
That's why I'm planning on forming a Tamer group,
to face off against those mean ol' hackers!
Chinese:
所以為了對抗那些壞蛋駭客，
我想要成立「馴獸師集團」。
Korean:
그래서 나, 나쁜 해커들에게 대항하기 위해서
「테이머 집단」을 결성하려고 해!
German:
Deshalb will ich eine Zähmer-Gruppe gründen, die es
mit diesen fiesen Hackern aufnimmt!

English: Tamer group?
Chinese: 馴獸師集團？
Korean: …테이머 집단?
German: Eine Digimon-Zähmer-Gruppe?

English:
You've both heard of a hacker team called the
"Judes"?
Chinese:
你們兩個知道「Jude」
這個駭客集團嗎？
Korean:
둘 다,「쥬드」라는
해커 팀을 알고 있어?
German:
Habt ihr beide schon mal vom Hacker-Team 
„Gamma“ gehört?

English:
I've totally heard of them!
Of course I haven't!
It's like I've heard but not heard of them...
Chinese:
完全不知道！
當然不知道！
好像知道又好像不知道……
Korean:
당연히 알고 말고!
당연히 모르고 말고!
아는 것 같기도 하고 모르는 것 같기도 하고…
German:
Natürlich habe ich das!
Natürlich nicht!
Irgendwie schon, aber auch nicht ...

English:
The Judes? They were a hacker team that was
active a little while ago, right?
Chinese:
Jude……是前陣子還挺活躍的
駭客集團吧？
Korean:
쥬드… 얼마 전에 활약했던
해커 팀이잖아
German:
Gamma? Das war ein Hacker-Team, das vor einer
Weile aktiv war, oder?

English:
That's right, Arata! I should've figured you'd
know your stuff.
Chinese: 不愧是新！你果然知道呢！
Korean: 역시 아라타! 잘 알고 있네!
German: Genau, Arata! Wusste doch, dass du dich auskennst.

English:
Although members of the Judes were hackers, they
never did anything evil that would have bothered
ordinary users or Digimon!
Chinese:
Jude的成員雖然也是駭客，
但絕對不會做出讓普通玩家和數碼寶貝困擾的事！
Korean:
쥬드의 멤버는, 해커면서도
일반 유저나 디지몬을 곤란하게 만드는 나쁜 짓은
절대로 하지 않았대!
German:
Einige Gamma-Mitglieder waren zwar Hacker, aber
sie haben nie etwas Böses getan, das normale
Nutzer oder Digimon stören würde!

English: So what are you getting at?
Chinese: 所以呢？
Korean: ……그래서?
German: Worauf willst du also hinaus?

English:
We can form a powerful team by gathering hackers
like former Jude members and other like-minded
folks!
Chinese:
所以我想找Jude以前的成員，
或是擁有相同想法的駭客來組成強大的隊伍！
Korean:
쥬드의 전 멤버라든가, 같은 생각을 갖고 있는
해커를 모아서, 강력한 팀을 만드는 거야!
German:
Wir können ein mächtiges Team zusammenstellen,
wenn wir Hacker wie die früheren Gamma-Mitglieder
und Gleichgesinnte versammeln!

English:
We'll call ourselves the Rebels! And we'll protect
Digimon and EDEN from evil hackers!
Chinese:
隊伍名就叫做「反叛者」！
是要從壞蛋駭客手中保護數碼寶貝和EDEN的隊伍！！
Korean:
그 이름은 바로「리벨리온즈」!
나쁜 해커들에게서 디지몬과 EDEN을 지키는 팀이야!!
German:
Dann nennen wir uns „Rebels“! Und beschützen
Digimon und EDEN vor bösen Hackern!

English:
Whaddya think? It's a totally great idea, right?
Don't you think the name kicks butt?
Chinese:
怎麼樣？這是個好主意吧？
不覺得名字也取得超酷的嗎！？
Korean:
어때어때? 엄~청 좋은 아이디어지!
네이밍도 WJ(완전 좋다) 라고 생각하지 않아!?
German:
Was meint ihr? Ist ’ne Superidee, oder?
Und ist der Name nicht spitze?

English:
And Arata would be our leader, of course!
There's no one else better for the job!
Chinese:
隊長當然就是新囉！
應該說除了新，別無他人！！
Korean:
물론 리더는 아라타야!
그보다 아라타밖에 없어!!
German:
Arata wäre dann natürlich unser Anführer!
Er wäre am besten geeignet!

English: What?
Chinese: 什麼？
Korean: …하아?
German: Wie bitte?

English:
Well, you're such an incredible hacker!
You saved me that time I was attacked in Kowloon!
Chinese:
因為新是個優秀的駭客啊！
我在Kowloon被那隻蟲蟲攻擊的時候，新也救了我！
Korean:
왜냐면 아라타, 우수한 해커인걸!
쿠롱에서도 흐물거리는 게 공격했을 때도, 구해 줬고!
German:
Na, du bist doch so ein fantastischer Hacker!
Du hast mich vor dem Angriff in Kowloon gerettet!

English:
Oh, and you'll be a Rebel too,
[p]!
Chinese: 啊！[p]也要參加唷！
Korean: 아, [p]도 참가야!
German:
Ach, du bist dann natürlich auch ein Rebel,
[p]!

English:
It's okay, it's okay! Don't worry!
I'll make you the Vice Assistant Leader! Okay!
Chinese:
放心吧！放心吧！沒什麼好擔心的！
副隊長會好好輔佐你的！
Korean:
괜찮아괜찮아! 걱정 안 해도
부 리더 보좌 정도는 시켜 줄 테니까! 응!
German:
Ja, ist ja gut! Keine Sorge!
Du bist dann der Vize-Hilfsanführer! Jawohl!

English:
Th-Thank you.
Um.
Don't worry about it...
Chinese:
謝……謝謝。
嗯……嗯！
不必費心……
Korean:
…고, 고마워
으, 으~음
신경 쓰지 않으셔도 됩니다…
German:
D-Danke.
Ähm.
Alles klar ...

English: There, then it's decided!
Chinese: 好！那就決定了～！
Korean: 네, 결정~!
German: So, dann steht es also fest!

English:
Is the "Rebels" a good name? We could also go with
the "Digimon Helpers," or DH for short!
Chinese:
隊名叫做反叛者可以嗎？
還是要叫「數碼寶貝看護士」，簡稱「數碼看護」也行唷！
Korean:
팀명은 리벨리온즈로 괜찮아?
아니면,「디지몬 헬퍼즈」줄여서「디지헬」이어도…!
German:
Ist „Rebels“ denn ein guter Name?
Wir könnten uns auch „Digimon-Helfer“ nennen,
DH als Abkürzung!

English: No thanks.
Chinese: 我拒絕……
Korean: …거절한다
German: Nein, danke.

English: What?
Chinese: 嗯？
German: Was?

English:
Y-Y-You won't do it?
Wait, why not? How come?
Chinese:
拒拒拒拒拒絕？
為什麼為什麼？到底為什麼？
Korean:
거거거거거절한다고?
왜왜? 어째서어째서?
German:
D-D-Du willst nicht?
Aber warum nicht? Wieso denn?

English:
Oh! Is it because you don't like the word
"leader"?
Chinese: 啊！難道是你不想當隊長？
Korean: 아! 혹시 리더인 게 불만인 거야??
German:
Ach! Liegt’s daran, dass dir das Wort „Anführer“
nicht gefällt?

English:
If that's the case, you can be the boss, or the
captain, or El Jefe, or whatever you prefer.
Chinese:
那那那…看你要當領袖、團長、教練或老大，
看你喜歡……
Korean:
저, 정 뭣하면, 보스여도 캡틴이어도 감독이어도 두목이어도
아라타가 좋을 대로 해도…
German:
Wenn das so ist, kannst du auch der Boss sein
oder der Cheffe oder der Käpt’n oder was auch
immer.

English: I don't have time for your game of make-believe.
Chinese: 我才沒時間陪妳玩“扮家家酒”！
Korean: …댁의 "소꿉놀이"에 어울려 줄 시간은 없어
German:
Ich habe keine Zeit für deine
Hirngespinste.

English: G-G-G-G-Game of make-believe?!
Chinese: 扮扮扮扮扮家家酒！？
Korean: 소소소소소소, 소꿉놀이!?
German: H-H-Hirngespinste?!

English:
I'm busy searching for the cause of that crazy
sickness. You can go do what you want.
Chinese:
我現在忙著調查那個奇怪病症的原因，
妳自己去玩吧！
Korean:
난 그 정신 나간 병의 원인을 찾느라 바빠
네 멋대로 하시지
German:
Ich suche nach der Ursache dieser verrückten
Krankheit. Du kannst machen, was du willst.

English: Hey, [p].
Korean: …야 [p]
German: Hey, [p].

English:
Is this really the best time for you to be hanging
out with someone like her?
Chinese: 你現在也不是陪這傢伙胡鬧的時候吧？
Korean: 댁도, 이런 녀석에게 어울려 줄 때야?
German:
Ist das für dich wirklich die richtige Zeit, um
mit jemandem wie ihr herumzuhängen?

English:
I need to talk to you.
Come to Shinjuku later. I'll be waiting.
Chinese:
我有話想跟你說，
等一下到「新宿」來……我等你。
Korean:
…잠깐 할 얘기가 있어
이따「신주쿠」로 와 줘… 기다릴게
German:
Ich muss mit dir reden.
Komm nachher nach Shinjuku. Ich warte dort.

English: What's up with that? This biiiiites!
Chinese: 什麼嘛！感覺超差勁的！
Korean: 뭐야 저거! 기분 나빠아아아앗!!
German: Was soll das denn? Das ist ja das LETZTE!

English:
Fine! He doesn't have to join us.
We can do it without him!
Right, [p]!?
Chinese:
算了！不肯當我的同伴就算了！
我們自己去組隊！對吧？[p]？
Korean:
됐거든요! 동료가 안 되어 줘도
멋대로 할 거거든요! 그렇지? [p]!?
German:
Na gut! Er muss ja nicht mitmachen.
Wir können das auch ohne ihn!
Stimmt’s, [p]?!
